glosses: to sag, hang; to hang down; to hang out; to lean out of
to flirt with, hit on someone, to molest

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish صارقمق (sarkmak, “to hang loosely, lean down”), from Proto-Turkic [Term?]. Cognate to Khorezmian Turkic [script needed] (sark-, “to hang limply”), Kipchak [Arabic needed] (sark-, “to hang down”).
